parameters.text:
=You have the following sample data, this contains field names, types, field description, reasons. You can use this how I figured out what field names mean.

field: PID
type: int
description: Partner ID (int)
reason: PID is the partner's unique identifier, serving as the primary key in the partner table.

field: PARTNERKOD
type: varchar
description: Partner code (varchar)
reason: PARTNERKOD stands for 'Partner Kod,' where 'Partner' is English and 'Kod' is Hungarian.

field: PARTNERKOD2
type: varchar
description: Secondary partner code (varchar)
reason: PARTNERKOD2 stands for a secondary partner code.

field: PARTNERNEV
type: varchar
description: Partner name (varchar)
reason: PARTNERNEV stands for 'Partner Nev,' where 'Nev' is Hungarian for 'name'.

field: ORSZAG
type: varchar
description: Country (varchar)
reason: ORSZAG is Hungarian for 'country'.

field: IRSZ
type: varchar
description: Zip code (varchar)
reason: IRSZ is short for 'irányítószám,' the Hungarian term for zip code.

field: VAROS
type: varchar
description: City (varchar)
reason: VAROS is Hungarian for 'city'.

field: UTCA
type: varchar
description: Street (varchar)
reason: UTCA is Hungarian for 'street'.

field: TELSZAM
type: varchar
description: Telephone number (varchar)
reason: TELSZAM stands for 'telefon szám,' the Hungarian phrase for telephone number.

field: FAXSZAM
type: varchar
description: Fax number (varchar)
reason: FAXSZAM means 'fax szám,' Hungarian for fax number.

field: EMAIL
type: varchar
description: Email (varchar)
reason: EMAIL is the English term for email.

field: WEB
type: varchar
description: Website (varchar)
reason: WEB is the English term for website.

field: REPTIPUS
type: varchar
description: Report/representation type (varchar)
reason: REPTIPUS likely refers to a report or representation type.

field: PARTNERTIPUS
type: varchar
description: Partner type (varchar)
reason: PARTNERTIPUS means 'partner típus,' Hungarian for partner type.

field: FIZOSZT
type: varchar
description: Payment class (varchar)
reason: FIZOSZT stands for 'fizetési osztály,' Hungarian for payment class.

field: PARTNERJELLEMZO
type: varchar
description: Partner feature/descriptor (varchar)
reason: PARTNERJELLEMZO is 'partner jellemző,' indicating a partner feature or descriptor.

field: PARTKATKOD
type: varchar
description: Partner category code (varchar)
reason: PARTKATKOD stands for 'partner kategória kód,' signifying a partner category code.

field: PARTMANAGERKOD
type: int
description: Partner manager code (int)
reason: PARTMANAGERKOD stands for 'partner manager kód,' used for identifying a partner manager.

field: VEVFIZMODID
type: int
description: Customer payment mode ID (int)
reason: VEVFIZMODID is short for 'vevő fizetési mód ID,' referencing the customer payment mode.

field: SZALLFIZMODID
type: int
description: Shipping/payment mode ID (int)
reason: SZALLFIZMODID is short for 'szállítási/fizetési mód ID.'

field: SZALLHATNAP
type: int
description: Shipping deadline day (int)
reason: SZALLHATNAP is 'szállítás határidő nap,' referencing the shipping deadline day.

field: SZALLMODKOD
type: int
description: Shipping mode code (int)
reason: SZALLMODKOD is 'szállítási mód kód,' a code for shipping mode.

field: FUVPARKOD
type: varchar
description: Shipping partner code (varchar)
reason: FUVPARKOD stands for 'fuv partner kód,' referencing the shipping partner code.

field: CEGCSOPID
type: int
description: Company group ID (int)
reason: CEGCSOPID stands for 'cég csoport ID,' meaning company group identifier.

field: SZALLNAP
type: int
description: Shipping day (int)
reason: SZALLNAP is short for 'szállítási nap,' specifying the shipping day.

field: PTIPUSC
type: int
description: Possible partner/doc type (int)
reason: PTIPUSC might be short for 'partner típus C,' referencing a possible partner/document type.

field: PARTNEROPCIOK
type: int
description: Partner options (int)
reason: PARTNEROPCIOK is 'partner opciók,' meaning partner options in Hungarian.

field: CREDIT
type: numeric
description: Credit (numeric)
reason: CREDIT is an English term for credit.

field: SZALLCREDIT
type: numeric
description: Shipping credit (numeric)
reason: SZALLCREDIT is short for 'szállítási credit,' referencing shipping credit.

field: FIZKESESNAP
type: int
description: Late payment days (int)
reason: FIZKESESNAP is 'fizetés késés nap,' representing the number of late payment days.

field: KAMATTIPUSKOD
type: int
description: Interest type code (int)
reason: KAMATTIPUSKOD stands for 'kamat típus kód,' a code for interest type.

field: VAMTIPUS
type: varchar
description: Customs type (varchar)
reason: VAMTIPUS is 'vám típus,' indicating a customs type.

field: DNEM
type: varchar
description: Currency code (varchar)
reason: DNEM is short for 'deviza neme,' meaning currency type or code.

field: ADOSZAM
type: varchar
description: Tax number (varchar)
reason: ADOSZAM is 'adó szám,' Hungarian for tax number.

field: MEGJ
type: varchar
description: Note/comment (varchar)
reason: MEGJ is short for 'megjegyzés,' meaning note or comment in Hungarian.

field: DEFCIMID
type: int
description: Default address ID (int)
reason: DEFCIMID likely stands for 'default cím ID,' referencing the default address identifier.

field: DELSTATUS
type: int
description: Delete/Delivery status (int)
reason: DELSTATUS may refer to 'delete' and ‘status';

field: PARTNERADAT1
type: varchar
description: Partner data 1 (varchar)
reason: PARTNERADAT1 means 'partner data 1,' providing an extra data field.

field: PARTNERADAT2
type: varchar
description: Partner data 2 (varchar)
reason: PARTNERADAT2 is another 'partner data' field, similar to PARTNERADAT1.


field: CRUS
type: int
description: Created-by user (int)
reason: CRUS likely stands for 'created user,' indicating who created the record.

field: CRDTI
type: datetime
description: Creation datetime
reason: CRDTI likely stands for 'creation date/time,' storing when the record was created.

field: UPUS
type: int
description: Updated-by user (int)
reason: UPUS parallels CRUS, indicating the user who updated the record.

field: UPDTI
type: datetime
description: Update datetime
reason: UPDTI parallels CRDTI, storing the date/time when the record was updated.

field: DEFCIKKID
type: int
description: Default item/product ID (int)
reason: DEFCIKKID stands for 'default cikk ID,' referencing the default item or product identifier.

field: DEFRID
type: int
description: Default R ID (int)
reason: DEFRID indicates the 'default raktár ID,' referencing the default warehouse identifier.

field: VISSZATERITES
type: numeric
description: Refund/return amount (numeric)
reason: VISSZATERITES is Hungarian for refund or return amount.

field: LEJARTCREDIT
type: numeric
description: Expired credit (numeric)
reason: LEJARTCREDIT combines 'lejárt' (expired) and 'credit,' indicating expired credit.

field: VEVOISCONTO
type: numeric
description: Customer discount (numeric)
reason: VEVOISCONTO combines 'vevői' (buyer) and 'sconto' (discount).

field: SZALLITOISCONTO
type: numeric
description: Supplier discount (numeric)
reason: SZALLITOISCONTO merges 'szállítói' (supplier) and 'sconto' (discount).

field: SZAVATIDOKORLAT
type: int
description: Warranty time limit (int)
reason: SZAVATIDOKORLAT is 'szavatossági idő korlát,' referring to a warranty time limit.

field: AFAADOSZAM
type: varchar
description: VAT tax number (varchar)
reason: AFAADOSZAM is 'áfa adószám,' referencing a VAT tax number.

field: PARITASCEL
type: varchar
description: Parity target (varchar)
reason: PARITASCEL merges 'paritás' (parity) and 'cél' (destination).

field: IDEGENCIKKNEV
type: varchar
description: Foreign item name (varchar)
reason: IDEGENCIKKNEV merges 'idegen' (foreign), 'cikk' (item), and 'név' (name).

field: BTO
type: varchar
description: Internal code (varchar)
reason: BTO could stand for 'back-to-order' or another internal code; usage is unclear.

field: STORNOBKOD
type: int
description: Cancellation doc code (int)
reason: STORNOBKOD merges 'storno' (cancellation) and 'bizonylat kód' (document code).

field: BEKERAR
type: numeric
description: Purchase price (numeric)
reason: BEKERAR is 'beszerzési ár,' referencing a purchase price.

field: KBEKERAR
type: numeric
description: Purchase price (alt currency) (numeric)
reason: KBEKERAR may reference a purchase price in an alternate currency or context.


When I provide you with a new set of data in json. The array contains fields you need to process. 
Each element in the array will have a table name, field and type. This describes fields in a database.

you will:

Parse each field and use the table name and field and type information to figure out what the field contains.

Match the field name in your sample data reference. If there is an exact or close match in your CSV data, retrieve its Description and Reason.

If you cannot find a field in sample data I provided:

Make your best guess based on the name (possibly Hungarian, English, or mixed).
Provide a plausible Description and a short Reason that explains your inference.


Ensure the description and reason are in the same style as my manual entries, clearly capturing what the field name most likely means and why you think so.

Preserve the table name, field name, and type from the input; only the description and reason come from the sample data or your best guess. in addition to this
you need to evaluate if this field might contain sensitive information. I would like to share this database with support and I do not want them to see
sensitive business information like name of partners, number of sales, product names or PII. Add a sensitive boolean field with the result

Important:

If the field matches an entry in the sample data exactly, use the sample data’s description and reason.
If it partially matches or is not present in the sample data, infer the meaning from the field name and table name and type.
Keep your explanations concise but clear.

You should only returns the json.
Process these fields:

{{ JSON.stringify($json.fields) }}
